text: Today we will talk about how we can do navigation in Next.js We will see some important client side hooks which you get to see in the next.js navigation package These hooks make it very easy for you to make Next.js apps We will see how they work in action I am really very excited You just like this video and keep writing Next.js in the comment section below Let's go to the computer screen Let's roll the intro So guys, as always I have made a folder named video132 I am going to open it in VS code I will click on shift right and then I will open it in VS code We are going to make a Next.js project So what we will do in this video We will understand some navigation specific hooks which Next.js provides So I want to take you to the documentation of Next.js Always open the documentation Because what happens with it is that the up-to-date code is in front of you The second thing is that the major change in Next.js was in version 12 to 13 If Next.js 14 to 15 which is coming So what will happen is that if 15 comes, then you guys don't get demotivated Because I will tell you that there is no such change in Next.js 15 Which majorly impacts your app See, there are changes and there are many changes in the backend In which the processes that are going to happen in the backend Which doesn't mean anything to you if you just want to make an app So that kind of process has been changed and made better So that's just to make the overall Next.js better These are mostly changes So don't worry at all Now here I am using the app router Let me tell you again What happens with it is that the app router and the pages router There are two different ways to make apps in Next.js I told you that the pages router was introduced before Next.js 12 Next.js 13 onwards we have the app router Which is a better approach according to me So we will take this Now what we will do is Here we will run npx create next app latest So that our Next.js app is made And after that I will put a dot What will happen with that is that all my files will spread here See, the versions of everything keep coming And here it is saying that you cannot make an app with the name video 132 No problem, we will make another app here And we will name it next navigation tutorial And I will not use TypeScript for now ESLint yes, tailwinds yes I will not do src directory either App router definitely I will do See, Next.js is recommending the app router itself And I am not going to tease import alias So now I will tell you how we go into this folder Then we will open it in VS code And from next navigation we will talk about specific hooks They are very amazing hooks And I am saying amazing because those hooks are very useful So I wait for it and then come back So our app is made here So what I will do is I will open it here And I will close this app that we have made And I will open this particular folder by right clicking and opening with code So we have an app, we have node modules We have all these initial files Definitely there is ph.js in the app directory So I will run npm run dev here And my next.js app will run Now here it will initially show a basic next.js app But what I will do is I will delete it And these pages also keep changing with versions If you remember when we started next.js in this course Then next.js had a separate page Will keep changing in the future So don't take tension, I am just telling you Don't take tension about it So what I will do here, I will make a div After this I will write here Hey this is our page And here you see hey
